Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

hic incipit dies iudicii et Ihesu descendente cum Michaele et Gabriele Archangelis et Michael dicet etcetera Michael Svrgite All men Aryse venite Ad judicium Ffor now is sett Ã¾e hy? justyce And hath Assygnyd Ã¾e day of dom Rape ?ow redyly to Ã¾is grett Assyse bothe grett and small All An sum And of ?our Answere ?ow now Avyse What ?e xal sey whan Ã¾at ?e cum ?owre Ansuere ffor to telle Ffor whan Ã¾at god xal ?ow appose ther is non helpe of no glose the trewth fful trewlye he wyl tose And send ?ow to hevyn or helle. Gabryell Bothe pope prynce and prysste with crowne Kynge and caysere and knyhtys kene Rapely ?e renne ?our resonys to rowne Ffor this xal be Ã¾e day of tene Nowther pore ne ryche of grett renowne ne all Ã¾e develys in helle Ã¾at bene Ffrom Ã¾is day ?ow hyde not mowne Ffor all ?our dedys here xal be sene Opynly in Syght Who Ã¾at is fowndyn in deedly gylte he were bettyr to ben hylte in hendeles helle he xal be spylte his dedys his deth xal dyght. Omnes resurgentes subtus terram clamauit ha aa ha aa ha aa. Deinde surgentes dicat ha aa etcetera. Ha aa cleue a-sundyr ?e clowdys of clay A-sundyr ?e breke and lete vs pas now may oure songe be wele-Away Ã¾at evyr we synnyd in dedly trespas. Omnes demones clamant Harrow and owt what xal we say harrow we crye owt And Alas Alas harrow is Ã¾is Ã¾at day to endles peyne Ã¾at vs must pas Alas harrow and owt we crye Omnes anime resurgentes dicant etcetera A mercy lorde ffor oure mysdede And lett Ã¾i mercy sprynge and sprede but alas we byden in drede It is to late to Aske mercye. Deus Venite benedicti my bretheryn all Patris mei ?e childeryn dere Come hedyr to me to myn hy? hall All Ã¾o myn suterys and servauntys be All Ã¾o ffowle wyrmys ffrom ?ow ffalle With my ryght hand I blysse ?ow here my blyssynge burnyschith ?ow as bryght as berall As crystall clene it clensyth ?ow clere All ffylth ffrom ?ow ffade Petyr to hevyn ?atys Ã¾ou wende and goo Ã¾e lokkys Ã¾ou losyn and hem vndo my blyssyd childeryn Ã¾ou brynge me to here hertys for to glade. Petrus The ?atys of hevyn I opyn Ã¾is tyde Now welcome dere bretheryn to hevyn i-wys Com on and sytt on goddys ryght syde Where myrthe and melody nevyr may mys. Omnes saluati On kne we crepe we gon we glyde to wurchepp oure lorde Ã¾at mercyfful is Ffor thorwe his woundys Ã¾at be so wyde he hath brought us to his blys holy lorde we wurcheppe Ã¾e. Deus Welcome ?e be in hevyn to sitt wel cum fro me xul ?e nevyr flitt so sekyr of blys ?e xul be ?itt to myrth and joye welcum ?e be. Anime dampnandum Ha Ha mercy mercy we crye and crave A mercy lorde for oure mysdede A mercy mercy we rubbe we rave A help us good lord in Ã¾is nede. Deus How wolde ?e wrecchis Any mercy haue Why Aske ?e mercy now in Ã¾is nede What haue ?e wrought ?our sowle to saue to whom haue ?e don Any mercyful dede Mercy for to wynne. Primus diabolus Mercy nay nay they xul haue wrake And Ã¾at on here fforehed wyttnes I take Ffor Ã¾er is wretyn with letteris blake Opynly all here synne. Deus To hungry and thrusty Ã¾at Askyd in my name mete and drynke wolde ?e ?eve non Of nakyd men had ?e no shame ?e wold nott vesyte men in no preson ?e had no pete on seke nor lame Dede of mercy wold ?e nevyr don Vn-herborwed men ?e servyd Ã¾e same to bery the deed pore man wold ?e not gon These dedys doth ?ow spylle ffor ?oure love was I rent on rode and for ?oure sake I shed my blode Whan I was so mercyfull and so gode Why haue ?e wrought a?ens my wylle. 2us diabolus I ffynde here wretyn in Ã¾in fforheed Ã¾ou wore so stowte and sett in pryde Ã¾ou woldyst not ?eve a pore man breed but ffrom Ã¾i dore Ã¾ou woldyst hym chyde. 3us diabolus And in Ã¾i face here do I rede Ã¾at if a thrysty man com any tyde Ffor thrust Ã¾ow he xulde be deed drynk ffrom hym Ã¾ou woldyst evyr hyde On covetyse was all thy thought. 1us diabolus In wratth Ã¾i neybore to bakbyte them for to hangere was Ã¾i delyte Ã¾ou were evyr redy them to endyte On Ã¾e seke man rewyst Ã¾ou nought. 2us diabolus Evyr-mor on Envye was All Ã¾i mende Ã¾[ou] woldyst nevyr vesyte no presoner to All Ã¾i neyborys Ã¾ou were vnkende Ã¾ou woldyst nevyr helpe man in daunger. 3us diabolus The synne of slauth Ã¾i sowle xal shende masse nore mateynes woldyst Ã¾ou non here to bery Ã¾e deed man Ã¾ou woldyst not wende. Ã¾erfore Ã¾ou xalt to endles ffere to slowth Ã¾ou were ful prest. ius diabolus Thou haddyst rejoyse in glotonye In dronkesheppe and in rebawdye Vnherborwyd with velonye Ã¾ou puttyst from here rest. 2us diabolus Sybile sclutte Ã¾ou ssalte sewe All ?our lyff was leccherous lay to all ?our neyborys ?e wore a shrewe all ?our plesauns was leccherous play Goddys men ?e lovyd but fewe nakyd men and ffebyl of array ?e wolde nott socowre with a lytel drewe nott with A thred Ã¾e soth to say Whan they Askyd in godys name. Omnes dampnandi A mercy lord mekyl of myght we Aske Ã¾i mercy and not Ã¾i ryght not after oure dede so us quyth we haue synnyd we be to blame. Deus
